meanings.definition: To make an effort to vomit
meanings.sent1: The smell of the rotten food made him retched.
meanings.sent2: After eating the spoiled milk, she retched violently.
meanings.sent3: The sight of the slimy slug made her retched in disgust.
meanings.sent4: The horror movie scene was so gruesome, it made him retched uncontrollably.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the medicine was so bitter, it caused her to retch involuntarily.

meanings.definition: To have an involuntary spasm of the throat, as from disgust or nausea.
meanings.sent1: The foul smell of the garbage made her retched suddenly.
meanings.sent2: He retched in revulsion at the sight of the decaying animal.
meanings.sent3: The prank was so unexpected, it caused him to retched in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The news of the tragedy made her retched with sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the strange fruit made him retched unexpectedly.
